'''Vulnerable area''' ({{lang-sv|Utsatt område}}) is a term applied by [[police in Sweden]] to areas with [[Crime in Sweden|high crime rates]] and [[social exclusion]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2054&artikel=6715164|title=Police add eight new "especially vulnerable" areas in Sweden - Sweden's "particularly vulnerable areas" - Radio Sweden|last=Radio|first=Sveriges|access-date=2017-10-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.newsweek.com/sweden-police-vulnerable-areas-no-go-zones-628029|title=Swedish police name dozens of "vulnerable areas"—but are they "no-go zones"?|date=2017-06-21|work=Newsweek|access-date=2017-10-18|language=en}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nrk.no/urix/svensk-politi_-_-vi-er-i-ferd-med-a-miste-kontrollen-1.12920404|title=Svensk politi: – Vi er i ferd med å miste kontrollen|last=NRK|work=NRK|access-date=2017-10-18|language=no}}</ref> In the December 2015 report, these areas numbered 53.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Utsatta områden - sociala risker, kollektiv förmåga och oönskade händelser|last=|first=|publisher=Police in Sweden - Nationella Operativa Avdelningen - December 2015|year=|isbn=|location=|pages=4}}</ref> In the June 2017 report, these totalled 61. The increase is reported to be due to better reporting, not a changing situation.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://polisen.se/Aktuellt/Nyheter/Gemensam-2017/Juni/Polisens-rapport-om-utsatta-omraden/|title=Polisens rapport om utsatta områden|last=Polisen|first=|date=|website=Polisen.se|language=sv|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-10-18|quote=Antalet områden som bedöms som särskilt utsatta är fler i den här rapporten jämfört med den förra rapporten. – Det beror främst på att vi nu har en fördjupad kunskap om problematiken i dessa områden, snarare än att läget har försämrats sedan förra året, säger Linda Staaf, underrättelsechef på nationella operativa avdelningen som ansvarar för att sammanställa rapporten.}}</ref> The overall trend is that these areas are improving.<ref name="SVTstat">{{Cite web|url=https://www.svt.se/nyheter/inrikes/laget-battre-i-utsatta-omraden|title=Läget bättre i utsatta områden|work=SVT|quote=Fler jobbar, inkomsterna är högre, bidragen lägre och färre är helt utanför systemen. /../ Sedan 1997 har exempelvis andelen förvärvsarbetande bland de utrikes födda i stadsdelen Rinkeby ökat från 29 procent till 49 procent 2015. Andelen öppet arbetslösa har samtidigt gått ner, från 18 procent till 15 procent.}}</ref>
All the areas are situated south of the town of [[Gävle]] and most are areas constructed during the [[Million Programme]] (MP), although there are towns north of Gävle having MP areas they do not experience the crime rate of some southern MP areas.<ref name=":2">{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%c3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|title=Utsatta områden - sociala risker, kollektiv förmåga och oönskade händelser|last=|first=|publisher=Police in Sweden - Nationella Operativa Avdelningen - December 2015|year=|isbn=|location=|page=21|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819054415/https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%C3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|archive-date=19 Aug 2016}}</ref>
== Characteristics == A vulnerable area is described as being geographically defined and having a low socioeconomic status and criminals negatively affecting society. The three categories of vulnerable area are divided along level of severity: vulnerable area, risk area and especially vulnerable area.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%c3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|title=Utsatta områden - sociala risker, kollektiv förmåga och oönskade händelser|last=|first=|publisher=Police in Sweden - Nationella Operativa Avdelningen - December 2015|year=|isbn=|location=|pages=13–14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819054415/https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%C3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|archive-date=19 Aug 2016}}</ref>
These areas are sometimes called no-go zones as emergency services such as fire engines and [[ambulance]]s cannot drive into these areas during a tense situation without a police escort as they will be attacked by criminal gangs.<ref name=":1" />
The population in these areas have higher rates of unemployment, whereas about 67% of the general population has employment, the share in vulnerable areas is about 49%.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.aftenposten.no/verden/i/GVLRV/Svensk-politi-skulle-ta-tilbake-kontrollen-over-utsatte-bydeler-fra-kriminelle-To-ar-senere-er-situasjonen-blitt-enda-verre-|title=Svensk politi skulle ta tilbake kontrollen over lovløse områder. To år senere er situasjonen blitt enda verre.|work=Aftenposten|access-date=2017-10-19}}</ref>
According to a 2017 report by [[Swedish Defence University]] , of those who have travelled from Sweden to conflict zones to participate in terrorist activities, 70% were residents in vulnerable areas.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=83&artikel=6717191|title=Terrorresenärer ofta från utsatta områden - Nyheter (Ekot)|last=Radio|first=Sveriges|access-date=2017-10-24}}</ref>
According to a 2018 report by [[Sveriges Television|Swedish Television]], the overall trend is that these areas are improving. Employment rates, income and school results are generally rising.<ref name="SVTstat"/>
Vulnerable areas have a low participation in election, where for instance in the Gårdsten district in Gothenburg only a third voted in the [[Swedish general election, 2014|2014 election]]. Journalists who visited Gårdsten to interview locals on why they didn't vote struggled to complete their task as many locals they encountered spoke neither Swedish nor English.<ref name=":7">{{Cite news|url=https://www.hemhyra.se/nyheter/har-struntar-varannan-valet/|title=Här struntar varannan i valet|last=|first=|date=|work=Hem & Hyra|access-date=2018-06-23|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623094651/https://www.hemhyra.se/nyheter/har-struntar-varannan-valet/|archive-date=23 June 2018|language=sv-SE}}</ref>
According to Japanese economist Takaaki Mitsuhashi, foreigners primarily from Africa and the Middle East have settled in districts which they then proceeded to take over. Having visited vulnerable area [[Husby, Stockholm|Husby]], he described it as "whatever it was, it wasn't Sweden".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://svenska.yle.fi/artikel/2018/08/11/japan-valkomnar-fler-utlandska-arbetare-men-kritiker-namner-sverige-som-varnande|title=Japan välkomnar fler utländska arbetare, men kritiker nämner Sverige som varnande exempel: "Utlänningarna är välkomna, men jag vet inte om de passar så bra att stå i butiker"|last=|first=|date=12 August 2018|work=Yle|access-date=13 August 2018}}</ref>
By 2018 gang violence, which had long been a feature of vulnerable areas, had begun to spill out into the wider society where hospital staff reported armed confrontations in emergency rooms and school authorities reported that threats and weapons having become commonplace.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/03/world/europe/sweden-crime-immigration-hand-grenades.html|title=Hand Grenades and Gang Violence Rattle Sweden’s Middle Class|last=Anderson|first=Ellen Barry and Christina|access-date=2018-08-15|language=en}}</ref>
=== Vulnerable area === An area in the vulnerable category is characterised by a low socioeconomic status and where criminals have a negative impact on society and public institutions. Criminals may use direct threats and [[blackmail]] or indirect methods such as public displays of violence which place bystanders at risk of injury or [[Illegal drug trade|narcotics openly traded]] in public spaces. The effect of their activities is that inhabitants experience lower levels of security which may make them less willing to participate or witness in judicial proceedings against criminals.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%c3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|title=Utsatta områden - sociala risker, kollektiv förmåga och oönskade händelser|last=|first=|publisher=Police in Sweden - Nationella Operativa Avdelningen - December 2015|year=|isbn=|location=|page=13|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819054415/https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%C3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|archive-date=19 Aug 2016}}</ref>
=== Especially vulnerable area === An area in this category is characterised by inhabitants having a potential threat from criminals in the area which has led to an overall disinclination to participate in judicial proceedings against criminals. In especially vulnerable areas there are systematic threats and violence against witnesses and plaintiffs. These circumstances make it very difficult or impossible for police organisations to complete [[Law enforcement|their mission]].<ref name=":0" /> In December 2015 these areas numbered 15.<ref name=":2" /> In June 2017 these areas numbered 23 as some areas were reclassified primarily due to more refined information, not that the situation changed.<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2054&artikel=6721866|title=Voices from a new "vulnerable area" - Radio Sweden|last=Radio|first=Sveriges|access-date=2017-10-19}}</ref>
An especially vulnerable area may to a certain extent also experience<ref name=":0" /> * [[Parallel society]] structures exercising their own form of justice and control<ref name=":1" /> * Extremism such as systematic violations of [[freedom of religion]] or [[fundamentalism]] which circumscribe rights and freedoms of the population. According to [[Magnus Ranstorp]] in 2017, [[salafi]] [[jihadism]] is present in some of these areas.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=83&artikel=6717450|title="De farligaste terrorresenärerna är kvar" - Nyheter (Ekot)|last=Radio|first=Sveriges|access-date=2017-10-24}}</ref> In the especially vulnerable areas there are individuals among the radical Islamic community which contribute to recruitment and financing of Islamic [[Islamic terrorism|terrorism]]. These individuals have access to youth via lectures, study groups or as the imam. Some [[Islam in Sweden|mosques]] located in or close to these areas may be a contributing factor to radicalisation.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/Organiserad%20brottslighet/L%c3%a4gesbild%20myndighetsgemensam%20slutlig.pdf|title=Myndighetsgemensam lägesbild om organiserad brottslighet 2018-2019 / Dnr:A495.196/2017|last=|first=|publisher=[https://polisen.se/Stockholms_lan/Aktuellt/Rapporter-och-publikationer/Organiserad-brottslighet/Publicerat-Organiserad-brottslighet/Lagesbild-om-organiserad-brottslighet/ Nationella underrättelsecentret / Polismyndigheten]|year=2017|isbn=|location=Stockholm|page=13|pages=|quote=Enligt Polismyndigheten har en stor del av terrorresenärerna koppling till utsatta områden. I de särskilt utsatta områdena finns ett antal personer inom den radikala islamistiska miljön. Dessa bidrar till rekrytering och finansiering av terrorism. Vissa av personerna har kontakt med ungdomar genom till exempel föreläsningar, studiecirklar eller som imam. Vissa moskéer, som ligger i eller i närheten av utsatta områden, är med stor sannolikhet en viktig faktor vad gäller radikalisering.}}</ref> * inhabitants travelling to conflict area to participate in combat * a high concentration of criminals.
Employment levels in February 2017 was about 47%.<ref name=":3" /> Many inhabitants are immigrants or children of [[Immigration to Sweden|immigrants]],<ref name=":3" /> in this category the share of immigrants in the district is around 50-60%.<ref name=":12">{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/Organiserad%20brottslighet/L%c3%a4gesbild%20myndighetsgemensam%20slutlig.pdf|title=Myndighetsgemensam lägesbild om organiserad brottslighet 2018-2019 / Dnr:A495.196/2017|last=|first=|publisher=[https://polisen.se/Stockholms_lan/Aktuellt/Rapporter-och-publikationer/Organiserad-brottslighet/Publicerat-Organiserad-brottslighet/Lagesbild-om-organiserad-brottslighet/ Nationella underrättelsecentret / Polismyndigheten]|year=2017|isbn=|location=Stockholm|page=|pages=20|quote=Diagram 15}}</ref>
In its 2017, police stated that [[welfare fraud]] was prevalent in these areas, where benefits administered by [[Swedish Public Employment Service]] and the [[Swedish Social Insurance Agency]] were targeted.<ref name=":5">{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/Organiserad%20brottslighet/L%c3%a4gesbild%20myndighetsgemensam%20slutlig.pdf|title=Myndighetsgemensam lägesbild om organiserad brottslighet 2018-2019 / Dnr:A495.196/2017|last=|first=|publisher=[https://polisen.se/Stockholms_lan/Aktuellt/Rapporter-och-publikationer/Organiserad-brottslighet/Publicerat-Organiserad-brottslighet/Lagesbild-om-organiserad-brottslighet/ Nationella underrättelsecentret / Polismyndigheten]|year=2017|isbn=|location=Stockholm|page=|pages=13-14, Diagram 4|quote=Uppgifter gör gällande att det i de särskilt utsatta områdena förekommer ett otillbörligt utnyttjande av välfärdssystemet. Det gäller förmåner som administreras av såväl Försäkringskassan som Arbetsförmedlingen. Ett exempel är att folkbokföringsuppgifter manipuleras för att man ska kunna tillskansa sig ersättning som man inte har rätt till.}}</ref> Police identified that [[Population registration in Sweden|resident registry]] figures were manipulated, for instance 2% of all apartments in [[Rinkeby]] have between 10-30 persons registered as residents, which leads to an inflated number people receiving welfare benefits.<ref name=":5" />
==== Education level in especially vulnerable areas ==== [[Education in Sweden|Education]] levels are lower than the general population in these areas, where 40% of the population has not completed [[Immigration to Sweden#Education|primary education]].<ref name=":3" /><ref name="Pol8">{{cite web|url=https://polisen.se/siteassets/dokument/organiserad_brottslighet/myndighetsgemensam-lagesbild-2018-2019.pdf|title=Myndighetsgemensam lägesbild om organiserad brottslighet 2018-2019 / Dnr:A495.196/2017|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=Swedish Police Authority|pages=18|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705024748/https://polisen.se/siteassets/dokument/organiserad_brottslighet/myndighetsgemensam-lagesbild-2018-2019.pdf|archive-date=5 July 2018|dead-url=|access-date=|quote=Under hösten 2015 skedde en stor ökning av antalet asylsökande till Sverige. Polismyndigheten bedömer att majoritetio av de asylsökande hade tagit sig till Sverige med hjälp av människosmugglare. Smugglingspaketen till Sverige bedöms kostar flera hundra tusen kronor per person.[...] Utnyttjande av personer i beroendeställningUnder hösten 2015 skedde en stor ökning av antalet asyl-sökande till Sverige. Asylsökande befinner sig ofta i en utsattsituation. De har bristande språkkunskaper och kännedomom hur det svenska samhället fungerar, vilket kan utnyttjas i brottsligt syfte. Polisen bedömer att majoriteten av de som söker asyl i Sverige bedöms ha tagit sig hit med hjälp av människosmugglare. Enligt polisen rör det sig i stort sett uteslutande om landsmän som smugglar landsmän. Många som har betalat för att ta sig till Sverige har betydande skulder till människosmugglarna och dessa skulder måste betalas av på något sätt}}</ref> According to BRÅ statistics, persons with only primary education (Swedish: ''förgymnasial utbildning'') are 5.7 times more likely to be registered for crime compared to persons with post secondary education (Swedish: ''eftergymnasial utbildning'') <ref name="Pol8" /> On average in 2017, less than half of 15-year-olds in Gothenburg especially vulnerable areas qualified for secondary education. In district [[Bergsjön]], 69.8% of 15-year-olds of ''Bergsjöskolan'' left primary education without achieving grades in numeracy and literacy to enter secondary education, the number being 67.3% for the ''Sjumilaskolan'' school of [[Biskopsgården]] district in Gothenburg compared to the national average of 17.5%.<ref name=":6">{{Cite news|url=https://www.gp.se/nyheter/sverige/%C3%B6ver-h%C3%A4lften-klarar-inte-skolan-i-utsatta-omr%C3%A5den-1.6352466|title=Över hälften klarar inte skolan i utsatta områden|work=Göteborgs-Posten|access-date=2018-06-09|language=sv}}</ref> The results were lower compared to five years earlier and interpreted as a worsening trend by researcher Anders Trumberg at [[Örebro University|Örebro university]].<ref name=":6" />
=== Risk area === A risk area fulfills all criteria for a vulnerable area but do not qualify in all the critera for an especially vulnerable area.<ref name=":0" /> In December 2015 these areas numbered 6.<ref name=":2" />
== Districts == According to the national operations section (sv: ''Nationella operativa avdelningen'') the districts and their classification are:<ref name="map_noa_utsatta_2015_p29">{{Cite book|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%c3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|title=Utsatta områden - sociala risker, kollektiv förmåga och oönskade händelser|last=|first=|publisher=Police in Sweden - Nationella Operativa Avdelningen - December 2015|year=|isbn=|location=|page=29|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819054415/https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/%C3%96vriga%20rapporter/Utsatta-omraden-sociala-risker-kollektiv-formaga-o-oonskade-handelser.pdf|archive-date=19 Aug 2016}}</ref><ref name="map_noa_utsatta_2017_p41">{{cite book|title=Utsatta områden - Social ordning, kriminell struktur och utmaningar för polisen / Dnr HD 44/14A203.023/2016|date=June 2017|publisher=[[Police in Sweden]] - Nationella operativa avdelningen - Underrättelseenheten|page=41|url=https://polisen.se/Global/www%20och%20Intrapolis/Ovriga%20rapporter/Utsatta%20omr%c3%a5den%20-%20social%20ordning,%20kriminell%20struktur%20och%20utmaningar%20f%c3%b6r%20polisen.pdf|accessdate=22 October 2017}}</ref>

{{Unreferenced|date=November 2009}} '''Yuantang''' is [[language game]] spoken by [[Hakka Chinese|Hakka]] speakers at [[Yuantang]] ({{Zh|c=苑塘}}), a village in [[Northern and southern China|southern China]]. It is also known as the ''snake language''{{Citation needed|date=November 2009}}. ==Rules== Example : 食饭 → 手习花散 [sit fan] → [siu jit fa san]; eat (rice) → ''hand + learn + flower + separation''. Clearly, the words 食 and 饭 are each split into two sounds, the initial and the rime, thus 食 [sit] is made up of the initial of 手 [s] and the rime of 习 [it], and similarly, 饭 [fan] is [f] from 花 and [an] from 散. This is similar to the traditional Chinese practice of representing sounds by two characters known as [[fanqie]].
This practice also resembles [[Jin Chinese|Jin]], another Sinitic language, in its process of splitting a monosyllabic word into two syllables. A similar process is also found in [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]]. ==History== There is no solid evidence for the original of Yuantang. But it is believed to be an invention of a local intellectual in [[Qing dynasty]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2009}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yuantang Dialect}} [[Category:Hakka Chinese]] [[Category:Language games]] [[Category:Chinese language]] {{Conlang-stub}}
